intro: Cyrtandra chavis-insectorum, commonly known as the insect-killer heliconia, is a tropical plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiral-shaped inflorescence. The plant features bright orange bracts that enclose its small, clustered flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
